steps.title: Substep 2 - B
steps.content: Telenor, a dominant provider in Myanmar, cut off internet access for more than a million people in Myanmar’s Rakhine and Chin states, and kept it off at the Burmese government’s behest.

steps.title: Substep 3
steps.content: In India, millions of residents of Kashmir have lived under digital siege since mid-2019, thanks in part to a shutdown executed by Bharti Airtel and its peers at the order of the Modi government.

steps.title: Substep 4
steps.content: Marginalized people in both conflict zones have suffered doubly from COVID-19 and communication disruptions. But the companies carried these orders out in different ways that had measurable differences for customers.
